results.title: The Gold Rush (1925)
results.brief_description: The Gold Rush, an immortal classic, is regarded as one of Chaplin’s very best films, interweaving to brilliant effect the pathetic tale of the Tramp’s apparently hopeless love for a dancehall girl with the funny story of the Tramp and his burly gold prospecting partner heading off to make their fortunes in the great Yukon gold rush. Through the entire film hangs Chaplin’s finely perceived view of the contrast between the Tramp’s selfless, humanitarian behaviour, and the unpleasant, brutish life of the gold town society. Rated: G

results.title: The Giving tree
results.creator_credit: Charlie O. Hayward, Nick Bosustow, Shel Silverstein and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: This poignant story about the relationships between a boy and a tree illustrates some truths about the meaning of giving, receiving and love. the tree unselfishly offers itself to the boy for climbing, for shade and for pleasure. But as the boy grows up his life takes him further and further away from the tree. But old age brings their relationship full circle. Based on the book by Shel Silverstein. Music and narration by Shel Silverstein. Animation by Charlie O. Hayward.

results.title: The Goddess of 1967 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Clara Law, Eddie L.C. Fong, Peter Sainsbury, Film Finance Corporation Australia, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Still Life Pictures
results.brief_description: The Goddess of 1967 is a drama from director Clara Law (Floating life) a native of Hong Kong, who lives and works in Australia. Boy (Rikiya Kurokawa) is a Japanese internet hacker and snake enthusiast whose dream car is a 1967 Citroen - the Goddess of the title - which he locates in Australia. When he goes to collect however he discovers the owner dead and he is forced to make a deal with Deirdre (Rose Byrne), the car owner’s blind and emotionally bereft niece. Boy agrees to take Deirdre to her outback hometown (a five day drive) where she plans to confront her estranged and abusive father. This film is saturated in an array of dense colours and images that are overwhelming with their beauty and poignancy. Deirdre’s blind and passionate dancing in a local bar; the burning of an old church; the otherworldliness of the Japanese settings - are all compelling scenes. Both Boy and Deirdre are running from dark pasts (witnessed in a series of flashbacks) but must reconcile their histories in order to move forward individually and as a couple. At times confounding with a desultory narrative, “The Goddess of 1967” ultimately succeeds as a film about family and treachery, revenge and forgiveness.

results.title: The Girl of the golden west = La Fanciulla del west
results.creator_credit: John Vernon, Piero Faggioni, BBC-TV and Covent Garden Video Productions
results.brief_description: La Fanciulla del west, opera in three acts by Giacomo Puccini with libretto by Guelfo Givinini and Carlo Zangarini and based on the play by David Balesco was performed at The Royal Opera House, Covent Garden and starred world acclaimed opera singer Placido Domingo (Dick Johnson aka Ramirez the bandit). Adapted for television this penultimate opera of Puccini’s, set in California during the Gold rush, is quite spectacular both in set design and costuming. Placido Domingo is superbly supported by Carol Neblett (Minnie, “the girl of the Golden West”) and Silvano Carroli (Jack Rance, the sherrif) along with Robert Lloyd and Gwynne Howell. Features The Royal Opera Chorus and The Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Nello Santi. Sung in Italian.

results.title: The Gin game [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Terry Hughes, Nederlander Film and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: A brilliantly acted comedy drama about a developing relationship between two very different individuals who reside in a nursing home - Weller (Hume Cronyn), a long time resident with a gruff and impatient exterior who has alienated most of the other elderly residents and timid newcomer, a diabetic, Fonsia (Jessica Tandy). Set on the sun porch of the nursing home, the two strike up a somewhat painful relationship over several games of gin rummy where each reminisces about their past, dredging up memories and emotions perhaps best left alone. Funny, sad, confronting, entertaining - it is a pleasure to watch two such great actors performing on stage. Originally produced for the Broadway stage and directed by Mike Nichols, D.L. Coburn’s Pulitzer Prize-winning play was a critical success travelling abroad to London and Russia and receiving the Tony and Drama Desk Awards for Jessica Tandy and the L.A. Drama Critics Circle Award for both Jessica Tandy and Hume Cronyn. This taped version for television was performed before a live audience in London in October 1979.

results.title: The Gillies report
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Almost Managing Company, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and M I G Productions
results.brief_description: Like a time capsule, this selection of highlights from the ABC television series “The Gillies report” captures some of the most memorable Australian political events, situations and politicians in a way you could never imagine. Features the brilliance and wit of Max Gillies along with some of Australia’s most highly talented writers and comedians including John Clarke, Wendy Harmer, Geoff Kelso, Richard Carleton, Tracy Harvey, Don Watson.
